title: Restaurant Conversations
description: Master essential phrases for dining out in Germany. Learn how to order food, ask questions, and handle restaurant interactions confidently.

prompts.text: Könnte ich bitte eine Reservierung für 2 Personen um 19:30 haben? Ich möchte einen Tisch reservieren. Die Speisekarte bitte.
prompts.gloss_en: Could I please have a reservation for 2 people at 7:30 PM?
prompts.natural_en: Could I please have a reservation for 2 people at 7:30 PM?
I would like a reservation for 2 people at 7:30 PM
prompts.translation: I would like a table for 2 people at 7:30 PM

prompts.text: Könnten Sie uns die Speisekarte bringen bitte? Ich möchte bestellen. Das Essen und Trinken bitte.
prompts.gloss_en: Could you bring us the menu please?
prompts.translation: Can you bring us the menu please?

prompts.text: Ich nehme das Schnitzel mit Pommes für 15€. Könnte ich bitte bestellen? Die Rechnung bitte.
prompts.gloss_en: I'll have the schnitzel with fries for 15 euros
prompts.natural_en: I'll take the schnitzel and fries.
prompts.translation: I'll have the schnitzel with fries for 15 euros

microNotes.text: Modal verbs like 'hätte' (would like) and 'können' (can) are used for polite requests in German.
In German, the verb typically comes second in main clauses, even with modal verbs.
